comment: Horrible stuff both in smell and taste. Not straight, not with water and not as a cocktail. Had a few shots and poured the rest down the drain. Most disappointing bottle I've ever tasted. Where's my refund!

Eye-opening  pleasant surprise! Mostly oats and a little barley blend. Smooth like silk going down but with a hint of Cheerios. Seriously. Weird, huh? A little off the beaten path for me but worth the diversion from all the brown whiskies.

Just got done making a manhattan with cocchi di torino, with this one, really impressed.  I love the juiciness im getting with it.  Still think my woodford rye is superior, but this is an enjoyable rye nonetheless
Well High West, our love affair has finally reached its zenith. I don't know what I just drank, but it shouldn't be bottled. Rye Guy...sad...
Quite surprisingly, add this to your coffee!!! I was astounded with the way it opened up!!

My first white whiskey. It's really interesting to taste unaged rye. It's light and crisp. It obviously lacks the caramelization it would gain from aging. The taste isn't all bad. It tastes like what it is, fermented raw grain. It's the high ABV that kills it. It's a more subtle taste profile that's completely overpowered by raw alcohol. Not available in Ontario.
